hive_lesson.title: 1464 Vietnam / Myranmar
hive_lesson.description: Abidemi talks about her summer break.

hive_text_custom.text: : So after Laos, where did you go?
: After Laos, I flew to Vietnam. And actually I took the bus into Vietnam.
: Yes. And in Vietnam, I traveled from the north, from Hanoi, to Ho Chi Minh City. But because my time was so short, I could only spend one or two days in each city.
: Ah! What city did you like the most?
: I think I prefer Hanoi the most. The food, the street food is amazing. It’s a very lively city, lots of motorcycles and traffic so it reminded me of Nigeria where I was born a little bit.
: And what did you do in Vietnam?
: I spent time in Hanoi. I also went to visit Sapa, which has a lot of rice
. So these are mountains where they’ve
rice fields. So the scenery, the view is really beautiful. And you also get to meet the

people, the local people there. So I enjoyed it.
And then from there I went to Hoi An, which is a very historical city, very beautiful night
by the river. And then I went to Ho Chi Minh City but I could only spend one night there before leaving for Myanmar.
: OK. And then, how was Myanmar? What did you do there?
: Myanmar was my last stop. And I didn’t have so much time there but I

to go—but I managed to visit some of the places I really wanted to see like Yangon, Bagan, and Mandalay. 
I would say that Bagan was the highlight. They had many temples from the past and just seeing that many of them, it was very
: So what country was your favorite?
: It’s hard to say. They each have their own good points but I think I would definitely like to visit Thailand again.
: Oh OK. Thailand is such a great place. Anyway, thanks Abidemi.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 5) The highlight was her trip to Myanmar was ______.

hive_text_custom.text: It has a lot of rice
A terrace is flattened hills that looks like steps in order to plant food. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
The rice terraces of Bali are very famous.
 Terraces help farmers hold water for their crops.

hive_text_custom.text: Here, the word plant is a verb, and it means to grow plants such as trees, flowers, and grass. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I planted some flowers in the garden.
 The hills are covered with planted wheat.

hive_text_custom.text: When you manage to do something that means you are able to do it, even though you were not sure you could. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Despite the traffic, I managed to get home early.
 I managed to finish my work on time.

hive_text_custom.text: When something is impressive, it is of very high quality. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
The ruins are very impressive.
 His salary is very impressive.

hive_text_custom.text: Scenery refers to things that make a place beautiful. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I love the mountain scenery.
 The scenery is best in the fall

Here, native means having longer cultural ties to an area than any other group. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
They speak the native language.
 I ate lots of native cuisine.
